pr_title: MULE-18623: DynamicConfigurationProvider leaks configuration instances on cache eviction

timeline.bodyText: why is this the problem? Who else can remove items from the cache?
timeline.author: marianogonzalez

replies.bodyText: There is a list in the parent class which isn't cleaned up
replies.author: eze210

replies.bodyText: that's not what I asked. Your fix is to move this from here to the remove listener. My question is, why does that fix the problem? that makes sense if the item gets removed from the cache from any place other than this. Which place is that?
replies.author: marianogonzalez

replies.bodyText:
The cache has a time-based eviction policy (see expireAfterAccess(expirationPolicy.getMaxIdleTime(), expirationPolicy.getTimeUnit()) )
It's automatically called on cache maintenance
replies.author: eze210
